DzFigure Class Reference
[Scene Items]

The class which represents TriAx figures (such as Genesis), introduced with DAZ Studio 4.x. More...

#include <dzfigure.h>

Detailed Description

The class which represents TriAx figures (such as Genesis), introduced with DAZ Studio 4.x.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DzFigure::DzFigure (  ) 

Default Constructor.

DzFigure::~DzFigure (  )  [virtual]

Destructor.

DzFigure::DzFigure ( const DzInFile *  file  )  [protected]

For internal use only.

This constructor is called by the Framework when loading from a file so that certain initializations can be skipped that will happen later in the file load process.

Parameters:
file The file from which this object was loaded.

Member Function Documentation

void DzFigure::addFollower ( DzSkeleton *  newFollower  )  [protected, virtual]

This method is called by the application whenever a skeleton (i.e. a clothing item) has been "fit to" this skeleton. It should not be called arbitrarily. It is provided so subclasses can override it and customize behavior. The default implementation does nothing.

Reimplemented from DzSkeleton.

DzBox3 DzFigure::calcLocalBoundingBox (  )  const [protected, virtual]
Returns:
A local-space bounding box which encompasses the bounding areas of all bones for this skeleton.

Reimplemented from DzSkeleton.

DzOrientedBox3 DzFigure::calcLocalOrientedBoundingBox (  )  const [protected, virtual]
Returns:
A local-space oriented bounding box which encompasses the bounding areas of all bones for this skeleton.

Reimplemented from DzSkeleton.

void DzFigure::draw ( const DzDrawStyle &  style  )  const [virtual]

Called by the frame work to draw the node in the 3D viewport. Derived classes should override this method to provide custom drawing operations in the 3D viewport. This method must only be called from inside a viewport drawing operation when there is an active OpenGL context!

Parameters:
style The view style and drawing options for the current drawing pass.

Reimplemented from DzNode.

void DzFigure::finalize ( bool  isRender = false,
bool  allowResChange = true 
) [virtual]

Finalizes the node's geometry cache.

Parameters:
isRender If true, the geometry cache will be finalized for a render operation, otherwise, the geometry will be prepared for a drawing operation.
allowResChange If true, the geometry is allowed to change resolution in the finalize. otherwise, the geometry will stay at it's current resolution.

Reimplemented from DzNode.

QIcon DzFigure::getIcon (  )  const [virtual]
Returns:
an icon that represents this node type

Reimplemented from DzSkeleton.

QPixmap DzFigure::getPixmap ( QStyle::State  state = QStyle::State_None  )  const [virtual]
Returns:
The icon displayed in the interface for the skeleton node types

Reimplemented from DzSkeleton.

void DzFigure::loadSection ( DzInFile *  file,
short  sectionID 
) [virtual]

Reads the weld list, the follow property and the follow skeleton from the native file format.

Parameters:
file The file being read
sectionID The ID of the section being read.

Reimplemented from DzSkeleton.

void DzFigure::postLoadFile ( const DzInFile *  file  )  [virtual]

Performs backwards compatibility fixes on items read from old files.

Parameters:
file The file that this object was read from.

Reimplemented from DzSkeleton.

void DzFigure::removeFollower ( DzSkeleton *  oldFollower  )  [protected, virtual]

This method is called by the application whenever a skeleton (i.e. a clothing item) is no longer "fit to" this skeleton. It should not be called arbitrarily. It is provided so subclasses can override it and customize behavior. The default implementation does nothing.

Reimplemented from DzSkeleton.

void DzFigure::render ( const DzRenderSettings &  settings  )  const [virtual]

Method called to allow each object to render itself using the RenderMan API. When this method is called, the current transform is already set to the the local space of this object.

Parameters:
settings The render settings that are being used for the current render pass.

Reimplemented from DzSkeleton.

void DzFigure::save ( DzOutFile *  file  )  const [virtual]

Saves the weld list, the follow property and the follow skeleton to the native file format.

Parameters:
file The file to save the data to.

Reimplemented from DzSkeleton.

void DzFigure::setObject ( DzObject *  object  )  [virtual]

Sets the object for this node

Parameters:
object The object that will be drawn by this node. The node takes ownership of this object and deletes it when it is no longer used.

Reimplemented from DzSkeleton.

void DzFigure::setPointer ( const DzInFile *  file,
short  sectionID,
short  pointerID,
DzBase *  ptr 
) [virtual]

Collects pointers for the weld list, the follow property and the follow skeleton when reading from the native file format.

Parameters:
file The file being read
sectionID The ID of the section being read
pointerID The ID of the pointer being read
ptr The pointer being read.

Reimplemented from DzSkeleton.

void DzFigure::update ( bool  isRender = false  )  [virtual]

Applies the welding operations for the figure to prepare it for drawing.

Parameters:
isRender If true, the welding will be render quality.

Reimplemented from DzSkeleton.
